title: Faust and Mephistopheles

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of various charcoals, with wiping, stumping, erasing, and incising, on cream wove paper altered to a golden tone.

medium_display: Various charcoals, with wiping, stumping, erasing, and incising, on cream wove paper altered to a golden tone
inscriptions: Signed recto, lower right along right edge, in black chalk: "od REDON"; and (diagonally) lower right, in white pencil: "O • REDON"; inscribed verso, lower center, in graphite: "77; 49 x 58"
credit_line: Gift of Dorothy Braude Edinburg to the Harry B. and Bessie K. Braude Memorial Collection
publication_history:
Guolibet, “Exposition Odilon Redon,” Le Tintamarre (April 15, 1894).

J. Cohen Gosschalk, “Odilon Redon,” Zeitschrift für Bildende Kunst (December 1910), p. 67, fig. 8.

Sven Sandström, Le monde imaginaire d'Odilon Redon; étude iconologique, trans. by Denise Naert (Lund, 1955),  pp. 95–96, 179, and 220, fig. 73.

Roseline Bacou, Odilon Redon (Geneva, 1956), I: pp. 58, 71, and 108; II: p. 48, no. 40 (ill.).

Roseline Bacou, “The Bonger Collection at Amen, Holland,” Apollo 80 (November 1964), p. 401.

Klaus Berger, Odilon Redon: Fantasy and Colour, trans. by Michael Bullock (New York, 1965), p. 225, no. 587.

Dario Gamboni, La plume et le pinceau: Odilon Redon et la litérature (Paris, 1989), fig. 35.

Alec Wildenstein, Odilon Redon, Catalogue raisonné de l’oeuvre peint et dessiné 2 (Paris, 1994), p. 167, no. 1078 (ill.).

Fred Leeman and Kevin Sharp, “Vroege verzamelaars van Redon in Nederland,” Jong Holland 10:3 (1994), p. 25, fig. 16.
exhibition_history:
Paris, "Deuxième Exposition des dessins de M. Odilon Redon," Salle du Journal ‘Le Gaullois’, February 1882.

Paris, Galeries Durand-Ruel, "Exposition Odilon Redon," March–April, 1894, cat. 23.

The Hague, Haagsche Kunstring, "Odilon Redon," May–June 1894, cat. 11.

Rotterdam, Kunstzaal Reckers, "Peintures, pastels, dessins et lithographies par Odilon Redon," May 1907, cat. 29.

Amsterdam, Larensche Kunsthandel, "Odilon Redon," May 7–14, 1909, cat. 45.

Cleveland Museum of Art, "Odilon Redon," November 29, 1951–January 20, 1952, cat. 29; traveled to The Walker Art Center, Minneapolis, February 1–March 1, 1952, and Jacques Seligmann and Company, New York, October 22–November 10, 1951.

Paris, Orangérie des Tuileries, "Odilon Redon," October 1956–January 1957, cat. 23.

The Hague, Gemeentemuseum, "Odilon Redon," 1957, cat. 9.

Berne, Kunsthalle, "Odilon Redon," 1958, cat. 26.

London, Matthiesen Gallery, "Odilon Redon 1840–1916," May–June 1959, cat. 9.

Cambridge, Mass., Fogg Art Museum, Harvard University, December 9, 1967–March 29, 1968.

The Art Institute of Chicago, "Odilon Redon: Prince of Dreams, 1840–1916," July 2–September 18, 1994, pp. 135, 140, and 141, figs. 13:6, 24, cat. 57; traveled to the Van Gogh Museum, Amsterdam, October 20, 1994–January 15, 1995; and the Royal Academy of Arts, London, February 16–May 21, 1995.

The Art Institute of Chicago, "Drawn to Form: Modern 
Drawings," June 11–September 7, 1999, checklist 46.

The Art Institute of Chicago, "Drawings in Dialogue: Old Master Through Modern, The Harry B. and Bessie K. Braude Memorial Collection," June 3–July 30, 2006, p. 112, cat. 75 (ill.).
provenance_text: Sold by the artist to Andries Bonger (1861–1936), July 9, 1894 [Chicago 1994]; by descent to his wife, Mme. Bonger (née Baroness Francoise van der Borch van Verwolde; 1887–1975), Almen, The Netherlands, until at least June 1959 [London 1959].  Sold by Peter H. Deitsch (1924-1970), New York, to Dorothy Braude Edinburg, November 14, 1962,  [invoice]; given to the Art Institute, 1995.
